GeneralInformation.School Vision: Purposeful Leaders with God as the Enabler
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Empowering our Students to be ready for Service to the Nation.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Success comes in many forms and everyone will chart their own paths to realise their potential. In Christ Church Secondary School, we are committed to enabling our students to take charge of their lives and keep focus on the things that matter most to them by learning to appreciate themselves and taking ownership of their own growth. Holding fast to our philosophy that each child has worth and must be nurtured to reach his/her fullest potential, the school aims to develop our students to be purposeful leaders where they have the drive to excel, are thoughtful contributors and active learners. Together with our nurturing team of staff, supportive parents, alumni and key stakeholders, we are dedicated to build the lives of our young charges.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: Government-aided Sch / Co-ed School / Single Session

School Distinctive Programmes.STEM: Developing 21st Century Competencies through an Inquiry approach  in Health Science and Technology
School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Developing Social Emotional Learning Competencies through Outdoor Adventure Learning

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school experience for our CHRians focuses on students knowing themselves during their Lower Secondary years and, as they progress to the Upper Secondary level, to continue to challenge themselves and strive towards building their dreams and contributing their best in all that they do. In building students' resilience and a can-do mindset, the school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP)- "Developing Social Emotional Learning Competencies through Outdoor Adventure Learning" is key to drawing our students out of their comfort zones and helping them discover their potential to overcome their fears and limitations.  The school believes that the cumulative successes in overcoming challenges will help build their social emotional competencies, putting them on the road to facing life with determination and living an active lifestyle. The school provides students with the opportunity to apply academic knowledge learnt across disciplines to authentic situations in collaboration with Woodlands Healthcare Campus (WHC) through the Applied Learning Programme (ALP)- "Developing 21st Century Competencies through an Inquiry Approach in Health Science and Technology".  Using Design Thinking process in ALP, students acquire critical and inventive thinking dispositions, empathy and communications skills through which prepare them for the complexities and challenges faced in the era of innovation and uncertainty.
